intro: Myosurus lepturus var. filiformis, commonly known as the slender bottlebrush, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems that are often covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces spikes of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or reddish in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
